title: Fear and Legends from Asian and Pacific Islander Heritage
description:
We're in the middle of Asian American and Pacific Islander Heritage month. While many people are celebrating the beautiful culture, we're sinking our teeth into the community's spooky folklore. With thousands of years of tradition, superstition and myths, there are so many horror stories that have been passed down over the years. The most frightening part about these tales is that sometimes people don't believe them, and by the time they do, it's already too late. 

First, deadly delusions
Followed by terror on the Island
Then, dying to survive 
Finally in our featured story, see no evil 

﻿Download June’s Journey free today on the Apple App Store or Google Play
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
